abstract: Sprint’s new Samsung Instinct is an iPhone wannabe, but it has its own personality.
snippet: Sprint’s new Samsung Instinct is an iPhone wannabe, but it has its own personality.
lead_paragraph: The story so far: Apple introduced the iPhone a year ago, and has sold six million of them. Then on Monday, Apple unveiled an improved model that brings faster Internet, G.P.S. and a much lower price to an already well-designed device.

headline.main: An Imitator That Rivals the iPhone
headline.print_headline: An Imitator That Rivals The iPhone

abstract: Thanks to a set of adapters that comes with the new $150 iP99 model of the iHome clock radio, the iPhone as well as various versions of the iPod can be docked.
snippet: Thanks to a set of adapters that comes with the new $150 iP99 model of the iHome clock radio, the iPhone as well as various versions of the iPod can be docked.
lead_paragraph: The iHome clock radio for the Apple iPhone has not changed radically from versions of the iHome for the iPod. They allowed you to insert the iPod into a dock built into the top of the clock radio for recharging and — here is the cool part — play the contents of the iPod through the clock radio’s speakers. Thanks to a set of adapters that comes with the new $150 iP99 model of the iHome, the iPhone as well as various versions of the iPod can be docked.

headline.main: Honey, Can You Answer That? The Clock Radio Is Ringing
headline.print_headline: Honey, Can You Answer That? The Clock Radio Is Ringing

abstract: You can save paper by going to Word’s Print Preview in the File menu and clicking the “Shrink to Fit” or “Shrink One Page” button.
snippet: You can save paper by going to Word’s Print Preview in the File menu and clicking the “Shrink to Fit” or “Shrink One Page” button.
lead_paragraph: Hate those printed Word documents that have a few lines spilling over onto the last page? You can save paper by going to Word’s Print Preview in the File menu and clicking the “Shrink to Fit” or “Shrink One Page” button, which has an icon showing multiple pages transforming onto one page. Word will automatically fiddle with the document’s text size and spacing to get it all on a single page. But if the shrinkage messes up your formatting or looks too cramped, undo it by pressing Control-Z (Command-Z on a Mac), which reverses the process.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Thinking Green When You Print
